intro: Ceropegia peculiaris, commonly known as the Ghost Plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that resemble ghostly shapes. The plant has succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to store water in its thick stems. Its flowers are pollinated by specific insect species, making it an important component of its local ecosystem.
